About.title: What is Qiskit Fall Fest?
About.desc:
The Qiskit Fall Fest is a global series of events held at universities worldwide on the theme of quantum computing. Taking place annually from October to November, these events are primarily planned and run by students with support from IBM Quantum, featuring a diverse range of programs.
The UTokyo Qiskit Fall Fest 2025 offers a venue for students interested in quantum technology to learn and experience quantum computers through workshops and a hackathon, aiming to foster an environment of collaborative learning and challenge among participants.
The year 2025 marks the 100th anniversary of the initial development of quantum mechanics. To honor this history, Qiskit Fall Fest in 2025 is themed around the progress of quantum science and innovation. Let's take a step together toward the future of quantum computing from the University of Tokyo!

Flow.title: Event Details
Flow.step0Desc: We will hold a catch-up session for participants new to Qiskit,\ncovering fundamentals such as environment setup and basic gate operations.
Flow.step1Desc: Learn the fundamentals and applications of quantum computing through lectures and hands-on sessions.
Flow.step2Desc: Apply your knowledge to develop quantum algorithms with your team. This is your chance to challenge yourself and bring ideas to life.
Flow.step3Desc:
Make a presentation of what your team has developed and receive feedback from the judges.
There will be prizes for the top teams!
